description: Variation of application L/HAV 1399/83 (Proposed redevelopment of existing dis-used Petrol Filling Service Station [revised plans received 25.11.83]) to remove condition 3 and have the site operating 24-hours, every day.
decision_conditions: The proposed changes to the host application would - through the introduction of a 24 hour night time use outside of a town centre, and in an area that does not have such uses - be unacceptable in principle, and uncharacteristic for the area. The proposed changes would therefore be unacceptable when assessed against policies 7.4 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016 (MALP), policies GC1, SD6, D14, HC6 of the draft London Plan, and policies DC23, DC55 and DC61 of the Havering Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008.

The proposed changes to the host application would, through an increase in noise and disturbance, arising from the proposed 24 hour operation of the site, have an unacceptable impact on neighbouring amenity, and would be unacceptable when considered against paragraph 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), policies 7.4 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016 (MALP), and policies DC23, DC55 and DC61 of the Havering Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent prior to the decision being issued.
